communications.subject: Montana Freedom of Information Act Request: Felicia L. Hamilton
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Montana Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Requesting any documents with Felicia L Hamilton name on it.     From August 2022n through November 2023 she was a LPN at the Yellowstone County Jail.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Michael W Toth

communications.subject: Information request-Felicia L. Hamilton
communications.communication:

Let me know if you have any other questions. Have a great day! 😊

Yellowstone County District Court
Marriage License/Research Requests
217 North 27th Street
Billings, MT 59101
(406) 256-2851
dc-recordsearch@yellowstonecountymt.gov<mailto:dc-recordsearch@co.yellowstone.mt.gov>


[untitled]
Please note: Montana has a very broad public records law.  Most written communications to or from County Employees and Officials regarding County business are public records available to the public and media upon request.  Your e-mail communication may be subject to public disclosure.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Tony Rodham
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning or describing Anthony Dean Rodham AKA Tony Rodham (August 1954 – June 7, 2019).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emma Best

    https://https://www.muckrock.comhttps://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?url_auth_token=AAAj2ProGzquHYFeb-SMkiAXsEc%3A1havfv%3AqhEPVvwNZvtJuOsC1Rf2Tv8lgiU&next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Ffederal-bureau-of-investigation-10%252Ftony-rodham-75287%252F%253Femail%253Dfoipaquestions%252540ic.fbi.gov

** 

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email
address. Questions regarding your FOIA request may be directed to
foipaquestions@fbi.gov. If you have received a FOIPA request number, please
include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

** 

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBI’s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBI’s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the ‘Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request tool’ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

To Whom It May Concern:

I wanted to follow up on the following Freedom of Information Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on June 11, 2019. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: Tony Rodham
communications.communication:
Thank you for contacting foipaquestions@fbi.gov.  Please check the status of your FOIPA Request at http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on “Check Status of Your FOI/PA Request” on the right side of the page, and follow the instructions below.

Check the Status of Your FOIPA Request
If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-0] please enter [1234567-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-1] please enter [1234567-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@ic.fbi.gov.

FIND STATUS OF FOIPA- Request statuses are updated weekly

Please enter the whole FOIPA number-Example: [1234567-000]

FOIPA:
Results will show the Request Number, Case Type and Process Description shown below:
FOIPA:
1234567-000

Case Type:
FOIPA

Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)
The FBI’s FOIPA Program is searching the FBI’s indices for potentially responsive documents.
You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.

NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.

Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  Currently, simple track cases average approximately 138 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Our complex requests in the medium processing track are currently averaging 571 days, large processing track are currently averaging approximately 1,289 days, and extra-large processing track are currently averaging 1,649 days for processing.

Respectfully,

Public Information Officer
Record/Information Dissemination Section (RIDS) FBI-Information Management Division
170 Marcel Drive, Winchester, VA 22602-4843
Direct: (540) 868-4593
Fax: (540) 868-4391
Questions E-mail: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI vexsome filer list (2016)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of the "vexsome filer list" which may also be known as a "serial filer list" or a "nuisance filer list." Include any other list of FOIA requesters used by your agency which lists FOIA requesters because of the quantity or type of FOIA requests they have submit or any other FOIA related behavior. Additionally, please include all records which mention when or how to add or remove a person from any of these lists or how being on such a list affects processing requests from listed requesters.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Petti

foipaquestions@fbi.gov. If you have received a FOIPA request number, please
include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

**

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBIâ€™s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBIâ€™s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the â€˜Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request toolâ€™ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1629134-000
communications.communication:
To whom this may concern,

I hope this message finds you well. I am Matthew Petti, writing in regards to my FOIA request number 1629134-000. Thank you for your prompt response. I really do appreciate the work of the Record/Information Dissemination Section, and if you can, please send them my regards for all the records they've helped unearth.

In his response letter dated 19 April 2024, Section Chief Michael G. Seidel wrote that "we are releasing documents from previous requests regarding your subject. We consider your request fulfilled. Since we relied on previous results, additional records potentially responsive to your subject may exist. If this release of previously processed material does not satisfy your request, you may request an additional search for records."

There is one particular additional record I would like to request a search for. In 2016, the FBI released something called an "HVT List" with the following headers: "Requester | Total Cases | Total IP Cases | Percent of Total Cases | Percent of Current IP Pending | Submitted Since January | Submitted Within Fiscal Year." In 2020, the FBI released a similar list with slightly different headers. You may find copies of both attached.

If such a document exists today, please release the most recent version. Thank you again for your efforts.

Sincerely,
Matthew

Thank you for contacting foipaquestions@fbi.gov.  Please submit a new request for the below requested information as this is a request for different information.

You may submit your request electronically at https://efoia.fbi.gov (available 24 hours a day), or mail it to FBI, Attn: FOIPA Request, 200 Constitution Drive, Winchester, VA 22602-4843.  Please be sure to include your contact information, to include complete mailing address, on any correspondence.

Additional information about the FOIPA can be found at http://www.fbi.gov/foia.

Should you have questions about preparing or submitting your request, please feel free to reach out.

Respectfully,


Public Information Officer
FBI - Information Management Division
200 Constitution Drive
Winchester, VA  22602

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: USPS Kiosk Digital Photographs
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

- Data management policies regarding USPS Self Service Kiosks (SSKs)
- Records related to USPS SSKs taking digital photographs of customers, excluding photographs of customers
- Privacy Impact Assessments for USPS SSKs
- Business Impact Assessments for USPS SSKs

For reference, a FOIA request from the Electronic Privacy Information Center found the kiosks captured and stored photographs of customers for a period of 30 days, this request seeks similar records. (See https://epic.org/wp-content/uploads/privacy/postal/postalapc.pdf)

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dwight Pina

communications.subject: Colorado Open Records Act Request: Erroneous Death Declaration 6/24/22
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

The CAD record/report and body-worn camera footage from Officer Eugene McComas related to the incident described below.

Incident: 6/24/22, 57yo female is declared dead and is then found to be alive. An internal investigation related to this incident later occurred. For reference: https://www.washingtonpost.com/nation/2022/11/04/denver-firefighters-dead-woman-alive/

If the requested body-worn camera footage is not available, I request the body-worn camera footage from the first arriving officer at this incident for which body-worn camera footage is available.

The requested records will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days.

Sincerely,

Patrick Wells

title: STL Fusion Center MOUs, MOAs, NDAs 2020-2024

communications.subject: The Missouri Sunshine Law Request: STL Fusion Center MOUs, MOAs, NDAs 2020-2024
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Missouri Sunshine Law., I hereby request the following records for the fiscal years of 2020, 2021, 2022, 2023 and current fiscal year of 2024.

• Records that show Memorandums of Understanding (MOUs), Memorandums of Agreement (MOAs), Non-Disclosure Agreements (NDAs) and other coordination, cooperation, or other resource or information sharing arrangements between St Louis Fusion Center: Terrorism Early Warning Group and federal, state or local agencies specifically including but not limited to law enforcement agencies

• Records showing the number of times information which was uploaded to the St. Louis Fusion Center: Terrorism Early Warning Group’s intelligence databases required correction or removal because the information was found to be erroneous, deficient or invalid

• Records showing the number of times information which was uploaded to the St. Louis Fusion Center: Terrorism Early Warning Group’s intelligence database required correction or removal because the source agency that provided information was found to lack authority to gather or share information

• Records showing the number of suspicious incident reports, suspicious activity reports, and field interview reports in the St. Louis Fusion Center: Terrorism Early Warning Group Intelligence databases

• Records that list all public agencies and/or private contractors providing services of any kind to St. Louis Fusion Center: Terrorism Early Warning Group

• Records that show the number of tips and leads in the St. Louis Fusion Center: Terrorism Early Warning Group’s intelligence databases received from intelligence information shared via email, phone, internet or submission of incident reports

• Records that show the number of tips and leads in the St. Louis Fusion Center: Terrorism Early Warning Group’s intelligence databases acquired from cellphone tower dumps, cell site simulators (commonly known as “Stingrays”), and surveillance cameras

• Copies of all contracts/agreements signed by the St Louis Fusion Center: Terrorism Early Warning Group

As the records sought detail the operations and activities of our government, I also request that fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public’s interest. I am seeking the records to analyze, inform and freely release to members of the public as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com. The requested records are not for commercial use.

I am willing to pay all reasonable duplication expenses incurred in the processing this Sunshine Law request. However, as I am a member of the public and requesting documents specifically for the purpose of increasing the public’s knowledge of governmental functioning, I will administratively appeal any denial of my request for a fee waiver.

If fees cannot be waived, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request be filled electronically by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kevin Hawkins

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the South Carolina Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

A spreadsheet listing all officer-involved shootings investigated by or otherwise reported to SLED from 2021-2023, including incident-level information specifying the date of each incident, race and gender of all subjects involved, what weapon if any they were armed with, any injuries or deaths resulting from the incident, the names of all officers involved, whether administrative investigations found the incidents to be justified under police department policy and any disciplinary actions taken against the officers as a result of the incident. If all aspects of this request are not available, please provide all relevant information responsive to this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Samuel Sinyangwe

communications.subject: Public Records Request :: P124281-111323
communications.communication:
Thank you for your interest in obtaining public records held by the King County Sheriff’s Office. Your request has been received and is being processed. Your request was received in this office on November 13, 2023 and given the reference number P124281-111323 for tracking purposes. 
 
Within five business days (excluding holidays) after receiving your request, we will: 
 
 
  * Provide the record(s); 
  * Or Acknowledge your request and give you a reasonable estimate of how long it will take to respond; 
  * Or Deny the request in writing, stating the reasons for the denial (this could also include a denial of part of your request and a granting of the remainder). 
The day the request is received does not count as one of the five (5) days. Weekends and holidays observed by the agency are also excluded in the calculation. 
 
Record(s) Requested: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents and communications between January 1, 2020 and the date this request is received mentioning the phrase "Regional UAS Working Group", along with any attachments and associated metadata.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

All documents and communications between January 1, 2020 and the date this request is received mentioning the phrase "Regional UAS Working Group", along with any attachments and associated metadata. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Rose Terse 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fking-county-sheriffs-office-2399%252Fregional-uas-working-group-king-county-sheriffs-office-154473%252F%253Femail%253Dkcso%252540mycusthelp.net&url_auth_token=AAATlkMFitx2rEEBFUawwtUL2VE%3A1r2j8Q%3AdNkr0m8nsEgoCn3Go8RGmGAQAdrxxrwdKfBXSjbE1Vw” The KCSO is experiencing a high volume of open requests, over 1,300 of which came in prior to your request. In order to ensure an adequate search for responsive records, your request requires an eDiscovery search of all KCSO users email for a nearly 4-year date range. Depending on the results of our search, we may need to respond to your request through a series of installments with a first installment by . If we are unable to meet this self-imposed disclosure date, we will let you know. If we are able to provide a response or update sooner, we will certainly do so. February 16, 2024 Your request is subject to fees as allowed under King County Ordinance 18949 and the Public Records Act, RCW 42.56.120 . Please visit our website  and select "What is the cost to obtain records" for more information. Once we have determined the scope of your request and responsive records, we may provide an estimate for fees requiring 10% down prior to processing your request. PLEASE NOTE: Per RCW 42.56.120(4), the KCSO reserves the right to close a records request after 30 days if a requester does not inspect, view, download, and/or pick up the records we provide. There is no obligation for us to continue producing records that are not being collected by a requester. RCW 42.56.120(4) states that if an installment of a records request is not claimed or reviewed, the agency is not obligated to fulfill the balance of the request. WAC 44-14-04006(1) states that a records request has been fulfilled and can be closed if an entirely unclear request has not been clarified,a request or installment has not been claimed or reviewed, or the requester cancels the request. 
Please reply directly to this message or log in to the Online Request System if you have any questions or would like to clarify or cancel this request. Sincerely, Kimberly Petty | Legal & Public Disclosure Program Manager Sheriff's Administration - Policy Direction King County Sheriff's Office www.kingcounty.gov/sheriff

title: Water Quality Complaints in Albany, Schenectady, and Troy MSA (Troy Water Department)

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Water Quality Complaints in Albany, Schenectady, and Troy MSA (Troy Water Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting access to and copies of records related to water quality complaints and issues within the Albany, Schenectady, and Troy Metropolitan Statistical Area (MSA) for the period from January 1, 2018, to the present.

Specifically, I am seeking the following information:

1) The total number of water quality complaints received by your agency/authority/utility, broken down by year.

2) A detailed summary of each water quality complaint, including:
2a. The date of the complaint
2b. The location (address or nearest cross streets) of the complaint
2c. The nature of the complaint (e.g., odor, taste, discoloration, contamination concerns)
2d. Any actions taken by your agency/authority/utility to address the complaint
2e. The resolution or current status of the complaint

3) Any reports, memos, or other documentation related to water quality complaints, investigations, and resolutions within the specified area and timeframe.

If any of this information is available in electronic format, I kindly request that you provide it via email. If physical copies are necessary, please inform me of any copying or postage fees in advance, and I will make arrangements for payment.

If any portion of this request is denied, please provide a detailed explanation for the denial and inform me of any appeal procedures available under New York State law.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jackson Parker

communications.subject: RE: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Water Quality Complaints in Albany, Schenectady, and Troy MSA (Troy Water Department)
communications.communication:
Subject: FOIL Appeal for Denial of Access - Water Quality Complaints in Albany, Schenectady, and Troy MSA (Troy Water Department)

Dear Records Access Officer,

I am writing to appeal the summary denial of access to records that I requested under the New York Freedom of Information Law (FOIL) on March 15, 2023. The request sought records related to water quality complaints and issues within the Albany, Schenectady, and Troy Metropolitan Statistical Area (MSA) from January 1, 2018, to the present. I have not received a response, acknowledgment, or any communication from the Troy Water Department regarding my request. Pursuant to FOIL, the agency is required to respond within five business days.

As a reminder, my original request sought the following information:

1) The total number of water quality complaints received by your agency/authority/utility, broken down by year.
2) A detailed summary of each water quality complaint, including the date, location, nature of the complaint, any actions taken, and the resolution or current status.
3) Any reports, memos, or other documentation related to water quality complaints, investigations, and resolutions within the specified area and timeframe.

I followed up on my original request with two subsequent emails on April 11, 2023, and April 26, 2023, requesting a response or an update on the status of my request. However, I have not received any acknowledgment or response from the Troy Water Department.

The summary denial of access to the requested records is in violation of FOIL. I respectfully request that you reconsider my request and provide the requested records or a valid explanation for withholding them within ten business days, as required by FOIL.

If my appeal is denied, please provide a written explanation for the denial and inform me of any further appeal procedures available under New York State law.

Thank you for your attention to this matter, and I look forward to receiving your response.
A letter stating that the request appeal has been rejected.

files.title: Appeal Rejected
files.source: Troy Water Department, Troy, NY

communications.subject: RE: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Water Quality Complaints in Albany, Schenectady, and Troy MSA (Troy Water Department)
communications.communication:
I am writing in response to your recent communication regarding my Freedom of Information Law (FOIL) request. I appreciate your attention to this matter, and I would like to address some of the points you raised in your letter.

Firstly, I understand your concern about the method of submission and tracking of FOIL requests. However, I would like to clarify that my request was submitted through MuckRock, a widely recognized platform used for submitting and tracking FOIL requests. This platform is designed to ensure transparency, accountability, and ease of use for both the requestor and the agency. It is not intended to circumvent any established procedures but to enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of the FOIL process.

Secondly, regarding the issue of timeliness, I would like to remind you that according to Article 6 (Section 84-90) of the New York State's Freedom of Information Law, an agency is required to respond to a FOIL request within five business days of receipt. If the agency cannot provide the requested records within that timeframe, it must provide a written acknowledgment of receipt and a reasonable date by which the request will be granted or denied. In this case, I have not received such acknowledgment or estimated date.

Lastly, I would like to reiterate my commitment to working collaboratively with your agency to fulfill this FOIL request. I understand the importance of following proper procedures and am willing to cooperate fully to ensure that this process is carried out in accordance with the law.

I kindly request that you reconsider your position and provide the requested records or a reasonable timeline for their provision. I look forward to your prompt response.

title: Uni-Dekalb / APD MOU for Police Power

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: Uni-Dekalb / APD MOU for Police Power
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of any Memorandum of Understanding, Memorandum of Agreement, Mutual Aid Agreement, or other, similar document allowing the Atlanta Police Department to exercise police power outside the City of Atlanta's territorial jurisdiction in unincorporated Dekalb County.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Free

communications.subject: RE: Georgia Open Records Act Request #P003798-041824
communications.communication:
Hi David, 

Thanks so much for your help with this request! I really appreciate it.

That said, I don’t think it’s what I requested. As I read it Section 3-4.2 of the manual describes the circumstances under which mutual aid can be requested / accepted, and the rules for doing so. 

But my request sought a record reflecting the process described in this manual actually happening: 

“A copy of any Memorandum of Understanding, Memorandum of Agreement, Mutual Aid Agreement, or other, similar document allowing the Atlanta Police Department to exercise police power outside the City of Atlanta's territorial jurisdiction in unincorporated Dekalb County.”

To narrow a bit, let’s focus on the property surrounding Key Road, Constitution, and Bouldercrest, where APD is currently exercising police power. Is there a memo of understanding for that exercise between DKPD and APD? If so, that’s what I thought I was requesting. Happy to file a new request and close this one out if it’s easier, but it also seems like a list of standing agreements reflecting the decisions laid out in 3-4.2 is a record DKPS would have that would be responsive to my original request. 

Thanks in advance! 


Sincerely,
Andrew Free

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #24-FOI-00180
communications.communication:
Dear FOIA Officer,

I just now saw your two-sentence request to narrow the scope of my request, sent on Feb. 20, 2024, with a deadline of five working days from the date it was sent. 

I am hoping that you might reconsider closure of the request with narrower parameters: 

I hereby request the following records:
- Any records of passenger complaints about the Amtrak train station at 418 North Adams Street, Mount Pleasant, IA 52641 spanning the time frame from 2020 to the date that this request is processed.
- Any records of Amtrak employee complaints or concerns about the Amtrak train station at 418 North Adams Street, Mount Pleasant, IA 52641 spanning the time frame from 2020 to the date that this request is processed.

Thank you for your reconsideration of my request!

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Sincerely,

Dhruv Mehrotra

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Autopsy report pertaining to cause of death as well as toxicology report for Angela Fresquez . 
Date of birth was August 31, 1987. Date of death was January 29, 2022.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Sincerely,

Ariel Smith

communications.subject: Fee notice - Records request
communications.communication:
Ms.  Smith,

We have received your request for the autopsy report regarding Angela Rollene Fresquez (ME-22-00694). The fee notice is attached. Please send the fee by money order or certified check made payable to: Travis County Medical Examiner and addressed to our office at P.O. Box 1748, Austin, TX 78767. We do not accept personal checks, cash or credit cards.

Please include our case number or the decedent's name, your mailing address, and signature on money order or certified check.

We will consider your request automatically withdrawn if you do not respond in writing to this notice and itemization of charges within ten business days from the date of this notice. Please advise us in your response if you accept the charges or are modifying your request. You may deliver your written response by: mail, fax (512-854-9044), or email (merequests@traviscountytx.gov<mailto:merequests@traviscountytx.gov>).

Best regards,
TCME Staff



________________________________

title: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Public Records Request - NY law enforcement agencies using CLEAR investigations software

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Public Records Request - NY law enforcement agencies using CLEAR investigations software
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

The State of New York entered in the Group 2070 statewide contract no. PC69955 with West Publishing Corporation, dba West, a Thomson Reuters business,  providing state and local jurisdictions with the use and access to a variety of databases developed by West.  

I am seeking any documents, reports, communications, lists, logs or datasets showing the names of state and local law enforcement agencies that have accessed services through the CLEAR investigations components of the Group 2070 statewide contract no. PC69955 with West Publishing Corporation and those law enforcement agencies that can use those components.

I would be pleased to speak with a representative from your office if there is any uncertainty about this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Paul Tepper

communications.communication:
Dear Paul Tepper, 
 
Thank you for registering with the NYS Office of General Services FOIL Records Access Center.  If you did not submit your request through the public portal but are receiving this e-mail, an account has been created for you. 
 
Once your email address has been verified, you can log into the FOIL Records Center to update any contact or password information.  You will also be able to monitor and track the progress of your request and receive most responsive documents. 
 Your Login ID is:  159444-67364549@requests.muckrock.com 
 
If you have never used this system or cannot remember your password you may request a temporary password here: Request Temporary Password (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.VEsWrlMiJDg0mXafq1mEXVzR6GJlMt0wQKdE2mGRW8K2rHo8q8zL-2BgIvhkH7mStT-2BbjBn2oYZfD4WuWtgnGEUw-3D-3Dny-N_eF1FvlIzuZOkMbCgNnezDpxkGe55X-2B5VZeCC4GmwzLgsSt8UEuEExfPLoDbVlVsFAY9s4zIvGRLEURp-2FPUi7WypjyxpWs3geZR-2FCh5uwDuZkJwSY1nkRFZiOhSHvwBneMW9mEW7Qkx7AYYGl8uHR1p66U6WmYMdPIqyQGUBGAta-2BqeK5kYQqjszT5XxeDoKvBOPJoM-2BxzTUd6cYFL-2F19jHdJmBFsdyfeR1-2FnZHNUB6Q-3D)

communications.subject: [Records Center] FOIL Records Request :: R000573-022724
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

RE: FOIL Records Request of February 27, 2024, Reference # R000573-022724. 
Dear Paul Tepper, 

This letter is regarding your request for records under the Freedom of Information Law which mentioned: Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records: 
The State of New York entered in the Group 2070 statewide contract no. PC69955 with West Publishing Corporation, dba West, a Thomson Reuters business, providing state and local jurisdictions with the use and access to a variety of databases developed by West. 
I am seeking any documents, reports, communications, lists, logs or datasets showing the names of state and local law enforcement agencies that have accessed services through the CLEAR investigations components of the Group 2070 statewide contract no. PC69955 with West Publishing Corporation and those law enforcement agencies that can use those components. 
We require additional time to process your request as we continue to collect and review records to ensure they are responsive to your request and not exempt from disclosure under Public Officers Law Section 87(2). 
The Office of General Services estimates it will complete your request and provide a response in writing by April 24, 2024. 
Sincerely, 

Georgina Parsons 
Records Access Officer

communications.subject: [Records Center] FOIL Records Request :: R000573-022724
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 
RE: FOIL Records Request of February 27, 2024, Reference # R000573-022724 

Dear Paul Tepper, 

The NYS Office of General Services (OGS) received a Freedom of Information Law request from you on February 27, 2024 which mentioned: 
The State of New York entered in the Group 2070 statewide contract no. PC69955 with West Publishing Corporation, dba West, a Thomson Reuters business, providing state and local jurisdictions with the use and access to a variety of databases developed by West.  I am seeking any documents, reports, communications, lists, logs or datasets showing the names of state and local law enforcement agencies that have accessed services through the CLEAR investigations components of the Group 2070 statewide contract no. PC69955 with West Publishing Corporation and those law enforcement agencies that can use those components. 
OGS has reviewed its files and has located responsive records to your request. Please log in to the FOIL Records Access Center at the following link to retrieve the responsive records. 
FOIL Records Request - R000573-022724 
Please note: These records are sales reports submitted by the contractor and represent sales covering the first six months of the contract only (March 22, 2023 - September 21, 2023), and do not necessarily represent “…the names of state and local law enforcement agencies that have accessed services through the CLEAR investigations components” under the current contract since its inception. Nonetheless, these are the only records we are able to provide specific to the request. Pursuant to Public Officers Law § 89(4)(a), you have 30 days to submit a written appeal of this determination to: 
Office of General Services FOIL Appeals Officer 
Empire State Plaza 
Corning Tower Building, 36th Floor 
Albany, NY 12242-0001 

Sincerely, 

Georgina Parsons 
Records Access Officer

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Key card access
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Ashley Magnine key card fob key access log from Sept 1, 2022 to June 1, 2023.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Michael T.

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Watercolor House Party
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

All documents and information related to the CLOSED CASE of the Watercolor house party, owned at the time were Ashley and Ryan Templeton.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Chase Galloway

Please note: Florida has a very broad public records law. communications.subject: [Records Center] POLICE - Public Records Request :: P003128-100123
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

Hello Sir, 
I understand that you think a citation should have been issued; however, the Lake Mary Police Department leaves citations to officer discretion.  The officers are not obligated to write a citation in a crash just as they are not obligated to always write a citation when they stop someone for speeding or any other traffic violation.  Ultimately, it is the crash report which shows fault in a crash.  I am  sorry I can't be of any more help in this matter. 
Take Care, 
Derrick Kuiper 
Sr. Records and Equipment Specialist 
Lake Mary Police Department

communications.subject: [Records Center] POLICE - Public Records Request :: P003128-100123
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

Hello Sir, 
We don't have the MRI, and even if we did, it was not a record generated by our agency so we would not be able to release it.  We only forward pertinent records that are requested by the State Attorney Office.  You may, as a private citizen, can send whatever you like to the State Attorney Office if you are seeking criminal charges against the other driver.  I would recommend speaking with one of the Assistant State Attorneys first, and then if they think you have something, they can create a case, take whatever you have, and they will ask us for whatever we have that is pertinent.  Hopefully this helps. 
Take Care, 
Derrick Kuiper 
Sr. Records and Equipment Specialist 
Lake Mary Police Department

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: FOIA Request: ARPA Funds
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

The Virginia Department of Criminal Justice Services awarded $75 million in American Rescue Plan Act funding as part of the Law Enforcement Equipment-Training Grant Program in order “to make one-time grants to state and local law enforcement agencies located in the Commonwealth, including colleges and universities, and, local and regional jails, for the purpose of training and purchasing equipment and supplies to support law enforcement related activities." https://www.dcjs.virginia.gov/sites/dcjs.virginia.gov/files/cjsb-materials/2023-05-11/Law%20Enforcement%20ARPA%20Grant%20Program.pdf

According to the press release from the Virginia Department of Criminal Justice Services, Hopewell was awarded $633,000 (grant application # 509290) as part of the Law Enforcement Equipment-Training Grant Program. 

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of all documents, including but not limited to, applications, agreements, and reporting documents related to the $633,000 received as part of the Law Enforcement Equipment-Training Grant Program.  

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with e.

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Third Party Investigative Platform (Purchase and Contract records) (Fresno Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the records listed below regarding the following four software programs: 

• Thompson Reuters Clear (https://legal.thomsonreuters.com/en/products/clear)
• LexisNexis Accurint (https://www.accurint.com/)
• TransUnion TLOxp, which may also be part of the TruLookup system (https://www.tlo.com/law-enforcement)
• SoundThinking CrimeTracer, which was formerly a product called COPLINK X (https://www.soundthinking.com/law-enforcement/crime-analysis-crimetracer/) from the company formerly known as ShotSpotter

For each of the above mentioned platforms, please provide the following records: 

• CONTRACTS AND AGREEMENTS —  All contracts (as well as associated amendments, attachments, and exhibits) and agreements related to the acquisition and use of these "software" programs.
• PURCHASE INFORMATION — All invoices and purchase information for costs and products associated with the above-referenced platforms.

Please provide responsive materials for the period from January 1, 2021 through the date this request is processed. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

{ Andrew Maples }

title: Chicago Drug and gang houses, houses of prostitution and other disorderly houses Ordinance

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Chicago Drug and gang houses, houses of prostitution and other disorderly houses Ordinance
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Any and all records from November 11, 2023 to January 1, 2024  regarding your nuisance property ordinance that will be referred to as "ordinance" in this request but could be known (but not limited to) as "Drug and gang houses, houses of prostitution and other disorderly houses" as described in Sec. 8-4-090 in Chicago's city code.

Please provide any and all written records (including but not limited to hard-copy documents, memos, emails, word processor documents, PDF documents, PowerPoint files, images files, video files etc.) regarding the Ordinance including but not limited to:

• evictions filed by property owners and number of tenants evicted as a result of the ordinance
• written notices from the authorized representatives of the city to the owner or controller of the premises identifying nuisances and abatement measures
• police calls, reports, citations, or arrests, collected by the municipality police department for the purpose of enforcing the ordinance
•fines and penalties collected for the purpose of enforcing the ordinance
• information regarding any court actions related thereto, including motions for court orders to place a property into receivership or condemnation

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jenny Wadhwa

The Department of Law does not possess records responsive to item 1 of your request.  Regarding items 2 & 3, please note that each City department is a separate “public body” under Section 2 of FOIA. 5 ILCS 140/2(a); Duncan Publishing, Inc. v. City of Chicago, 304 Ill. App. 3d 778, 784 (1st Dist. 1999) (“Clearly, each of the individual departments are subsidiary bodies of the City and are ‘public bodies’ as defined by the FOIA.”).  A FOIA request must be directed to the Department that maintains the records you seek. 

Regarding item 4 of your request, please see the attached.  Note that this record is sourced from the Department of Finance, as the Department of Law does not track this information. This spreadsheet reflects fines paid during the requested period on cases that were previously dismissed. 
You have the right to have a denial reviewed by the Public Access Counselor (PAC) at the Office of the Illinois Attorney General, 500 S. 2nd Street, Springfield, Illinois 62701, (877) 299-3642. You may also seek judicial review of a denial under 5 ILCS 140/11 of FOIA. If you have any questions or need additional information, please feel free to contact my office at 312-744-6976. Sincerely, Lexie Heinemann 
Public Relations Representative 
Department of Law

communications.subject: [Records Center] Department of Law :: F064919-011124
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

 January 18, 2024 RE: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST of January 11, 2024, Reference # F064919-011124. Dear Jenny Wadhwa, This correspondence is in response to the Freedom of Information Act ("FOIA") request received by the City of Chicago Department of Law on January 11, 2024. You requested: "To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records: 

Any and all records from November 11, 2023 to January 1, 2024 regarding your nuisance property ordinance that will be referred to as "ordinance" in this request but could be known (but not limited to) as "Drug and gang houses, houses of prostitution and other disorderly houses" as described in Sec. 8-4-090 in Chicago's city code. 

Please provide any and all written records (including but not limited to hard-copy documents, memos, emails, word processor documents, PDF documents, PowerPoint files, images files, video files etc.) regarding the Ordinance including but not limited to: 

• evictions filed by property owners and number of tenants evicted as a result of the ordinance 
• written notices from the authorized representatives of the city to the owner or controller of the premises identifying nuisances and abatement measures 
• police calls, reports, citations, or arrests, collected by the municipality police department for the purpose of enforcing the ordinance 
•fines and penalties collected for the purpose of enforcing the ordinance 
• information regarding any court actions related thereto, including motions for court orders to place a property into receivership or condemnation 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Jenny Wadhwa 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fcity-of-chicago-department-of-law-7387%252Fchicago-drug-and-gang-houses-houses-of-prostitution-and-other-disorderly-houses-ordinance-156877%252F%253Femail%253DLAWfoia%252540cityofchicago.org&url_auth_token=AAAzzWcQr2qjchx_8-xfl_gQ2zA%3A1rO6aT%3A2bX-mtaCOmHq89-MPYbD5IuVPaY6Go0guaTL1WmYnpU" 
Apologies for the additional message. Regarding your fifth item, the Department of Law does have any responsive records. We do not track receiverships, and “condemnation” is not a relief that is sought in Housing Court cases. If you have any questions or need additional information, please feel free to contact my office at 312-744-6976. Sincerely, Lexie Heinemann 
Public Relations Representative 
Department of Law

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fcity-of-chicago-department-of-law-7387%252Fchicago-drug-and-gang-houses-houses-of-prostitution-and-other-disorderly-houses-ordinance-156877%252F%253Femail%253DLAWfoia%252540cityofchicago.org&url_auth_token=AAAzzWcQr2qjchx_8-xfl_gQ2zA%3A1rO6aT%3A2bX-mtaCOmHq89-MPYbD5IuVPaY6Go0guaTL1WmYnpU" 
Please be advised that the Department of Law responded to your request and furnished records in response to item 4 on January 18, 2024. Our response further stated that Department of Law does not possess records responsive to item 1 of this request.  Regarding items 2 & 3, each City department is a separate “public body” under Section 2 of FOIA. 5 ILCS 140/2(a); Duncan Publishing, Inc. v. City of Chicago, 304 Ill. App. 3d 778, 784 (1st Dist. 1999) (“Clearly, each of the individual departments are subsidiary bodies of the City and are ‘public bodies’ as defined by the FOIA.”).  A FOIA request must be directed to the Department that maintains the records you seek. Additionally, there were no responsive records for item 5. You have the right to have a denial reviewed by the Public Access Counselor (PAC) at the Office of the Illinois Attorney General, 500 S. 2nd Street, Springfield, Illinois 62701, (877) 299-3642. You may also seek judicial review of a denial under 5 ILCS 140/11 of FOIA. If you have any questions or need additional information, please feel free to contact my office at 312-744-6976. Sincerely, Lexie Heinemann 
Public Relations Representative 
Department of Law

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Communist Activities in Africa
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

FBI file 64-HQ-200 Sub 302, captioned "Communist Activities in Africa". Please include all enclosures behind file (EBFs) and bulky files if they exist.

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies. If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Paul Galante

correspondence will be forthcoming.

you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

communications.subject: FOIA request 1469314/64-HQ-200-302
communications.communication:
Good afternoon Mr. Galante,

We're contacting you about the FOIPA request above.  The FBI located approximately 1933 pages potentially responsive to your request.  In response to the cost letter to you dated August 28, 2020, you submitted a check for $55, which was returned to you because no fees were owed at that time.
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system:
      Small track requests (0-50 pages) current average time is approximately 4 months to complete;
      Medium track requests (51-950 pages) current average time is approximately 29 months to complete;
      Large track requests (951-8000 pages) current average time is approximately 60 months to complete; and
      Extra-large track requests (over 8000 pages) current average time is approximately 84 months to complete.
The current average time to complete your large track request is at least 60 months. Reducing the scope of your request may accelerate the processing, allow for a timelier receipt of the information you seek, and reduce the duplication costs, if applicable.  Would you be willing to consider reducing the scope of your request to place it in a smaller, potentially faster processing track?
Please let us know if you would like to move forward with reducing the scope of your request.  If you do reduce the scope of your request, you are welcome to request additional material once your release has been made.

Best regards,

FBI FOIA Negotiation Team
Information Management Division
fbi.foipa.negotiation@fbi.gov<mailto:fbi.foipa.negotiation@fbi.gov>
540-868-1695

Status Checks: https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps | foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>
For additional information, please visit the www.fbi.gov/foia<http://www.fbi.gov/foia> website.
COVID-19 Impact: The Records Information/Dissemination Section (RIDS) is operating at reduced staffing levels amidst the ongoing COVID-19 national emergency. We appreciate your patience and understanding as we work to release as much information, to as many requesters as possible, as this emergency continues.

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL EMAIL] -  RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1469314-000
communications.communication:
Thank you for contacting foipaquestions@fbi.gov.  Please check the status of your FOIPA Request at http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on “Check Status of Your FOI/PA Request” on the right side of the page, and follow the instructions below.

Check the Status of Your FOIPA Request
If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-0] please enter [1234567-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-1] please enter [1234567-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@fbi.gov.

FIND STATUS OF FOIPA- Request statuses are updated weekly

Please enter the whole FOIPA number-Example: [1234567-000]

FOIPA:
Results will show the Request Number, Case Type and Process Description shown below:
FOIPA:
1234567-000

Case Type:
FOIPA

Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)
The FBI’s FOIPA Program is searching the FBI’s indices for potentially responsive documents.
You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.

NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.

Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  Currently, simple track cases average approximately 104 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Our complex requests in the medium processing track are currently averaging 853 days, large processing track are currently averaging approximately 1,786 days, and extra-large processing track are currently averaging 2,500 days for processing.

Respectfully,

Public Information Officer
FBI - Information Management Division
200 Constitution Drive
Winchester, VA  22602
O: (540) 868-4593
E: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

communications.subject: Oregon Public Records Law Request: CDC Alcohol Taxes
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Oregon Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting records of all written communications between Oregon Health Authority officials and employees or officials from the Centers for Disease Control (CDC) regarding alcohol taxes (including taxes on beer, wine, and spirits) that occurred between July 1, 2021, and December 31, 2023.  

Additionally, I am requesting records of all written communications between the Oregon Health Authority and the CDC regarding the "Rethink The Drink" advertising campaign and any communications referencing "ECONorthwest" during the same period of time (July 1, 2021, through December 31, 2023).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Eric Boehm

communications.subject: Public Records Requests - OHA/CDC Communications Related to Rethink The Drink and EcoNorthwest (OHA Request No. 2024-0328)
communications.communication:
VIA EMAIL ONLY - Eric.Boehm@Reason.com<mailto:Eric.Boehm@Reason.com>

March 26, 2024

Eric Boehm
Reporter
Reason Magazine
Arlington, VA

Re: Public Records Requests - OHA/CDC Communications Related to Rethink The Drink and EcoNorthwest (OHA Request No. 2024-0328)

Good Afternoon Eric,

You have submitted a public records request for:


  *   Written communications between Oregon Health Authority officials and employees or officials from the Centers for Disease Control (CDC) regarding alcohol taxes (including taxes on beer, wine, and spirits) that occurred between July 1, 2021, and December 31, 2023;
  *   Written communications between the Oregon Health Authority and the CDC regarding the "Rethink The Drink" advertising campaign from July 1, 2021, through December 31, 2023; and
  *   Written communications between Oregon Health Authority and the CDC referencing "ECONorthwest" from July 1, 2021, through December 31, 2023.


OHA Policy OHA-010-010 requires that a complete request for records include a description of the information requested, as specific as possible, including the type of records, subject matter, approximate dates the records were created, and the names of the persons involved. As submitted, your request is overly broad. Call me at your convenience to discuss clarifying and narrowing the scope of your request. Alternatively, you may wish to search previously released records<https://www.oregon.gov/oha/ERD/Pages/Public-Records-Requests.aspx> that may satisfy your request. Please let me know how you wish to proceed.

Jeanne Windham
Public Records and Internal Litigation Process Coordinator
OREGON HEALTH AUTHORITY
Central Operations
500 Summer St. NE, E-20
Salem, OR  97301
(971) 345-1688
jeanne.windham@oha.oregon.gov<mailto:jeanne.windham@oha.oregon.gov>

title: Survey of New Jersey Open Records Act Resources (Municipal Clerk, Cherry Hill Township)

communications.subject: New Jersey Open Public Records Act Request: Survey of New Jersey Open Records Act Resources (Municipal Clerk, Cherry Hill Township)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Jersey Open Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. A copy of any budget, accounting, or other records sufficient to show the expenses or resources necessary for the city (including any departments thereof) to respond to public records requests.

2. A copy of the job description for any person (whether employed by the city or any departments thereof) whose primary responsibilities include responding to or managing public records requests. If a separate record identifies the anticipated or actual amount of time the person spends on their duties (i.e., identifying how much of their time is spent on a given subject), please provide that record, as well.

3. Any record sufficient to show the salary of any person (whether employed by the city or any departments thereof) whose primary responsibilities include responding to or managing public records requests.

4. If the city maintains a log of public records requests, please provide a copy of the log dating back to January 1, 2022.

Requests 1-3 are limited to documents generated during or concerning the last fiscal year.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

responsive document attached

3. Any record sufficient to show the salary of any person (whether
employed by the city or any departments thereof) whose primary
responsibilities include responding to or managing public records
requests. - total salaries of employees who work on OPRA $627,775.00

4. If the city maintains a log of public records requests, please
provide a copy of the log dating back to January 1, 2022. - responsive
document attached

By way of this e-mail, which includes the documents responsive to your
request, we have marked your OPRA request received April 17, 2024 as
satisfied and closed. 

A copy of the Denial Poster with instructions to applicants who wish to
appeal any denial or part thereof is attached hereto. You have the
right to appeal the decision that the document or documents are not
public records. You may take your appeal to the Government Records
Council or the New Jersey Superior Court, as provided by N.J.S.A.
47:1A-1 et seq. 

If you have any additional questions and/or concerns, or if we can be
of further assistance, please do not hesitate to contact our office at
(856) 488-7892. 

Thank you for your time. 

Patti Chacker, RMC
Township Clerk 
By: Danielle Gyenge


	
Update Notification Preferences <https://www.sdlportal.com/account>  	
Please do not respond to this email. For assistance, contact the
municipality directly.	 
	
			
	SDL Portal - Spatial Data Logic 2023

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: July 2023 Personnel Orders Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting a record of personnel orders issued by the Boston Police Department between July 14th and July 30th, 2023.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jamie Loftus

Please note this response will apply only to the records that exist and are in the custody of the Department. See A Guide to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, p. 32, n.115.  It is expected that a custodian of records must user her superior knowledge of her records with respect to responses to public records requests.  See 950 C.M.R. 32.04(5). communications.subject: City of Seattle Public Records Request Center - Invoice Ready :: C167170-011424
communications.communication:
Dear Rose Terse, 
 
Records in response to your public disclosure request C167170-011424 received on January 14, 2024 are now available. The cost for the records is as follows: 
 
Invoice Number: INV24-C167170-1 
Total: $1.25 
 
To pay online, please follow these steps: 
 Please note that you will need to disable any pop-up blockers to make a payment using the system. 
 
  * Navigate to the Public Records Request Center. 
  * Select 'My Records Request Center'. 
  * Select 'View My Requests'. You may be asked to login. 
  * Find this request: C167170-011424. 
  * Select the 'View Invoices' button. 
 
  * Opens a pop-up window showing your invoice: INV24-C167170-1. 
  * Click on the invoice and then the 'Pay Now' button. 
  * Continue processing your payment. 
  * Select 'Done'. 
  * Once the payment process is done, you are returned to the Public Records Request Center. 
  * After your payment is successful you will receive an email from our payments center. 
Once your payment has been approved, we will send you an email with instructions on how to download your records. Note that City staff must manually upload records. Records will be available one to two business days after payment. 
 
Please let your public disclosure officer (PDO) know if you are unable to pay online; your PDO will work with you on alternative ways to make your payment. 
 
You have 30 days from today's date to pay for your records. If the City does not receive your payment within this time period, your request will be considered abandoned, and you will need to submit a new request. 
 Please add seattle@mycusthelp.net to your E-mail contacts/address book to ensure delivery of the record center E-mails to your Inbox. (mailto:seattle@mycusthelp.net) 
This is an auto-generated email and has originated from an unmonitored email account. Please DO NOT REPLY.
